revised_title: Regeneration and Functional Connexions of Vagus Nerve Fibers
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the regeneration and functional connections of vagus nerve fibers with the cells of the superior cervical ganglion. The results showed that afferent and efferent fibers of the vagus nerve can grow and form connections with the peripheral end of the sympathetic nerve. This suggests that there is no essential difference between pre-ganglionic and post-ganglionic fibers in the autonomic nervous system.
